<Link id="l00474" /><CodeLine lineNumber="474"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00475" /><CodeLine lineNumber="475"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Timer Globals</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="476"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00477" /><CodeLine lineNumber="477"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Previously, these were independent ManagedStatics. This led to bugs because</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="478"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// there are dependencies between the globals, but no reliable mechanism to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="479"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// control relative lifetimes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="480"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="481"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Placing the globals within one class instance lets us control the lifetimes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="482"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// of the various data members and ensure that no global uses another that has</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="483"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// been deleted.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="484"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="485"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Globals fall into two categories. First are simple data types and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="486"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// command-line options. These are cheap to construct and/or required early</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="487"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// during launch. They are created when the ManagedTimerGlobals singleton is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="488"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// constructed. Second are types that are more expensive to construct or not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="489"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// needed until later during compilation. These are lazily constructed in order</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="490"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to reduce launch time.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="491"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timerglobals"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/timerglobals">llvm::TimerGlobals</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
